articles.title: Coronavirus Canada Updates: Five new COVID-19 cases in Nunavut - lintelligencer
articles.content:
The Government of Nunavut announced five new cases of COVID-19 in the territory on Thursday.
All of them are in Arviat, the territorys hardest-hit community, which now counts 68 active cases of the … [+1115 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: What's happening in Canada and around the world on Sunday - CBC.ca
articles.description: The "vast majority" of Canadians remain susceptible to COVID-19, Canada's chief public officer of health Dr. Theresa Tam said on Sunday, as the country's most populous province reported another record number of new cases over a 24-hour period.
articles.content:
The latest:
  • Ontario reports record high of 1,924 new cases of COVID-19 Sunday.
  • Chief public health officer warns 'vast majority' of Canadians remain susceptible to infection.

articles.description: The Middlesex-London Health Unit (MLHU) is reporting a jump of 39 new coronavirus cases Sunday.
